New Records: Devon Conway scored 92 runs, the highest by a New Zealand player in a T20 World Cup match
Key Match Events: Devon Conway set the tone with 14 runs off Mitchell Starc in the first over
Aaron Finch and David Warner were dismissed early, leaving Australia struggling
Glenn Phillips made a crucial catch to dismiss Tim David
New Zealand's bowlers, including Tim Southee and Mitchell Santner, performed well
Pre-Game Insights: The match was a repeat of the 2021 final, adding to the rivalry between the teams
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand avenged their 2021 loss and started their campaign strongly
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was sold out at the Sydney Cricket Ground
Young players like Finn Allen contributed with quick boundaries
New Zealand's victory was a significant moment in the tournament
Others: This was New Zealand's first win against Australia in Australia since 2011
The match was the opening game of the 2022 T20 World Cup
